content: On June 27, 1997, the Atlanta Braves faced off against the Philadelphia Phillies in a thrilling game that showcased the prowess of pitcher Greg Maddux. Maddux delivered a masterful performance, throwing a complete-game shutout while allowing just five hits and striking out eight batters. This victory not only highlighted Maddux's dominance during the season but also contributed to the Braves' impressive run as they headed towards their fifth consecutive division title.
